summary: This document is a series of email exchanges between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) personnel and contractors, primarily concerning scheduling meetings for the following week. The meetings are to discuss 'Maxwell discovery' and involve 'the Brass' and 'the Epstein team'.

events.title: Scheduled Meeting on Maxwell Discovery
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Monday at 11 AM involving a USANYS attorney and 'the Brass' to discuss Maxwell discovery.

events.title: Scheduled Team Meeting with the Brass
events.description: A meeting is scheduled for Thursday at 11 AM involving a USANYS attorney, their team, and 'the Brass'.

keyFacts: The emails are internal US Attorney's Office (SDNY) correspondence regarding scheduling meetings related to the Epstein/Maxwell case in July 2020.
The primary purpose is to schedule two meetings for the following week: one focused on 'Maxwell discovery' and a broader team meeting.
The participants referred to include 'the Brass' (likely senior DOJ/SDNY officials) and 'the Epstein team' (the prosecution team).
All specific individual names of attorneys, contractors, or officials are redacted in the provided text.
The correspondence indicates ongoing case preparation and coordination within the SDNY regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell prosecution.
